News.Title: Hinduja Global Solutions Reports Q2 FY2026 Results and Board Approves Director Re-appointment
News.Summary: Hinduja Global Solutions Limited announced its unaudited financial results for the quarter and half-year ended September 30, 2025. The company reported consolidated total income of Rs. 1,222.9 crore for Q2, up 3.0% quarter-on-quarter and 1.3% year-on-year. Revenue from operations was Rs. 1,091.0 crore, increasing 3.3% QoQ and 0.4% YoY. Total EBITDA stood at Rs. 158.0 crore with margins of 12.9%. For the six-month period, total income was Rs. 2,410.2 crore with revenue from operations at Rs. 2,147.3 crore. The Board of Directors approved the re-appointment of Mr. Vynsley Fernandes as Whole-time Director and Chief Executive Officer-Media Business for a three-year term from November 14, 2025, subject to shareholder approval through postal ballot. The company added 19 new digital CX/tech solution clients and 10 HRO/Payroll processing clients during the quarter. HGS operates across nine countries with 30 global delivery centers and employs 18,017 people as of September 30, 2025.

News.Title: Tax Panel Rules Hinduja Global-NxtDigital Merger as Tax Avoidance Scheme, Demands Rs 1,203 Crore Recovery
News.Summary: The Approving Panel has classified the merger between Hinduja Global Solutions Ltd. and NxtDigital Ltd. as an impermissible tax avoidance arrangement under India's General Anti-Avoidance Rules. The panel disallowed Rs 1,203 crore in tax set-offs and ordered recovery of the full tax amount with interest and penalties. HGSL had sold its healthcare division for Rs 8,000 crore, generating Rs 3,059 crore in capital gains, then merged with loss-making NxtDigital which had Rs 1,500 crore in accumulated losses. This allowed HGSL to offset losses against profits, reducing tax liability by Rs 281 crore. The panel found that internal communications revealed tax savings as the primary merger motive, with no genuine commercial substance or business synergy between the companies. The ruling represents a significant setback for the Hinduja Group and reinforces the government's strict approach to tax avoidance through corporate restructuring.

News.Title: HGS Launches AI-Powered Interaction Intelligence Solution to Transform Customer Experience
News.Summary: Hinduja Global Solutions (HGS) announced the launch of Interaction Intelligence, an enterprise-grade artificial intelligence solution built on the HGS Agent X framework. The solution transforms Quality Assurance from a routine customer service function into a strategic asset that delivers actionable insights. It enables enterprises to analyze nearly 100% of customer interactions across omni-channels, expanding traditional QA coverage by up to 100 times. The platform combines conversational, behavioral, and operational metrics in real time to provide visibility into compliance, agent performance, and customer loyalty drivers. Benefits include enhanced customer experience through better-trained agents, cost competitiveness through reduced costs and revenue generation via cross-selling and up-selling, improved brand reputation, and actionable insights for strategic decision-making. The solution measures tone, empathy, accuracy, and procedural adherence at scale. HGS Global CEO Venkatesh Korla stated the launch positions the company to capitalize on increasing customer experience transformation investments within a rapidly growing market. The company is currently deploying the solution for clients in the Americas. This launch marks HGS's evolution from traditional BPO to an AI-powered Intelligent Experience Company.

News.Title: Hinduja Global Solutions Opens New Intelligent Experience Hub in Manila, Philippines
News.Summary: Hinduja Global Solutions announced the opening of a new intelligent experience hub in Manila, Philippines. The facility is located in Manila's prime business district and consolidates HGS teams from across the city into a single, purpose-built environment. The company plans to create more than 1,000 new jobs over the next 24 months in business services and digital transformation. The new center has an initial capacity of 1,500 seats and can accommodate up to 3,000 employees in two shifts. With this addition, HGS now operates two facilities in Manila and four across the Philippines. HGS had previously signed a Letter of Intent with the Philippines government to scale its local operations. The hub is designed to support technology-driven business needs and features collaborative spaces for delivering technology-enabled solutions to clients.

News.Title: Hinduja Global Solutions Reports Mixed Q1 FY2026 Results with 169 bps EBITDA Margin Improvement
News.Summary: Hinduja Global Solutions achieved total income of Rs. 1,187.3 crores and operating revenue of Rs. 1,056.2 crores in Q1 FY2026. EBITDA reached Rs. 159.7 crores with margins of 13.5%, up 169 basis points year-over-year. However, revenue declined sequentially from Rs. 1,161 crores in Q4 FY2025 due to seasonal softness and customer ramp-downs. The company reported negative PAT of Rs. 46.3 crores from continuing operations but positive total PAT of Rs. 11.2 crores including discontinued operations. HGS is prioritizing margin expansion over topline growth and transforming into an AI-enabled intelligent experiences company. The board approved a 5-year business transformation plan focusing on digital services and AI platform Agent X, which is deployed across 20 BPM clients with 5,000 active users. In the media business, NXTDIGITAL faced challenges with Rs. 38.8 crores loss in Q1 versus Rs. 30.5 crores profit in previous quarter, primarily due to Rs. 30 crores in unbilled marketing deals and increased content costs. The company maintains strong balance sheet with net worth of Rs. 7,980 crores and cash surplus of Rs. 5,140 crores.

News.Title: Hinduja Global Solutions Reports 13.5% EBITDA Margin with Focus on AI-Driven Digital Services
News.Summary: Hinduja Global Solutions reported operating revenue of Rs 1,056.2 crore (US$ 123.9 million) and total income of Rs 1,187.3 crore (US$ 139.2 million) for quarterly results. The company achieved total PAT of Rs 11.2 crore (US$ 1.3 million) and EBITDA of Rs 159.7 crore (US$ 18.7 million) with margins at 13.5%, representing a 169 basis points expansion year-over-year. The company is experiencing continued macro-economic volatility and extended client sales cycles, with seasonality in key verticals moderating revenue growth. HGS is emphasizing margin expansion over topline growth, driven by changing revenue mix toward digital services and deployment of its internally developed Agentic AI platform HGS Agent X. The sales pipeline shows strong traction for digital services, with current order pipeline in Americas region being upwards of 55% in this segment. The company's AI platform is deployed across 20 clients covering approximately 5,000 active users, delivering 40% training optimization, 25% productivity gains, and 30% reduced costs. Digital media business NXTDIGITAL maintained stable ARPUs, with organic business segment and CelerityX together contributing 37% of revenues compared to 30% contribution in the previous fiscal year.

News.Title: Hinduja Global Solutions Approves Q1 Results and Major Leadership Changes
News.Summary: Hinduja Global Solutions Limited's Board approved unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company announced significant leadership changes including the retirement of Non-Executive Non-Independent Director Paul Abraham due to other commitments, with his tenure ending at the September 25, 2025 AGM. The Board approved the appointment of Amit Saharia as Non-Executive Non-Independent Director effective September 25, 2025, subject to shareholder approval. Saharia brings 25 years of industry and global management consulting experience and currently holds a leadership role at Hinduja Group responsible for shaping future strategy. The company also appointed Virendra G Bhatt as Secretarial Auditor for five years from FY 2025-26 to FY 2029-30. In senior management changes, Pushkar Misra, President - APAC, retired after 25 years of service, with Giridhar G V taking over as Head - APAC. N K Rouse, COO - Media Business, resigned due to family commitments after 11 years with the company. The 30th Annual General Meeting is scheduled for September 25, 2025, via video conferencing.
